Who was Artemisia Gentileschi, when was she born, and what influences shaped her artistic style?

Artemisia Gentileschi [Q212657, name: Artemisia Gentileschi] was born Artemisia Gentileschi Lomi in Rome [Q212657, place of birth: Rome] on July 8 1593 [Q212657, date_of_birth: 1596-07-08] although her birth certificate from the Archivio di Stato indicated she was born in 1590 the eldest child of the Tuscan painter Orazio Gentileschi [Q212657, father: Orazio Gentileschi] [Q367360, name: Orazio Gentileschi, occupation: painter] and Prudenzia di Ottaviano Montoni. Her life and work were later depicted in the film "Artemisia" [Q212657, Artemisia Gentileschi, depicted by: Artemisia], which brought her story to a wider audience. Her father, Orazio, was a prominent figure in the Mannerism art movement [Q367360, Orazio Gentileschi, movement: mannerism], which likely influenced Artemisia's own artistic style. However, Artemisia herself was a part of the Caravaggisti movement [Q212657, Artemisia Gentileschi, movement: Caravaggisti], a group of artists who followed the style of Caravaggio. She was also a student of her father, Orazio Gentileschi [Q212657, Artemisia Gentileschi, student of: Orazio Gentileschi], which further shaped her artistic development. Orazio’s influence on Artemisia’s development as a prominent Baroque [NA] painter can be seen in her highly naturalistic portrayal of figures, dramatic scenes and the use of chiaroscuro technique [NA].
